messages.content: What inputs can cdxgen use in CLI mode to generate an SBOM?
In CLI mode, cdxgen accepts Source Code, Container Images, or Binary Artifacts as input.
What are some common use cases for the SBOM generated by cdxgen?
Common use cases include: Breaking the build, vulnerability management, and license compliance.
How do I install cdxgen using npm?
Run the command sudo npm install -g @cyclonedx/cdxgen.
How do I install cdxgen using Homebrew?
Run the command brew install cdxgen.
How do I install cdxgen using Deno?
Run the command deno install --allow-read --allow-env --allow-run --allow-sys=uid,systemMemoryInfo,gid,homedir --allow-write --allow-net -n cdxgen "npm:@cyclonedx/cdxgen/cdxgen".
How do I use the cdxgen container image?

Run the command docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen -r /app -o /app/bom.json. To specify a version, use docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen:v8.6.0 -r /app -o /app/bom.json.
How do I use the cdxgen-deno container image?
Run the command docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-deno -r /app -o /app/bom.json.
How do I get help with cdxgen's CLI?
Run the command cdxgen -h.
What is the purpose of the -o or --output option?
It specifies the output file for the generated SBOM. The default is bom.json.
What is the purpose of the -t or --type option?
It specifies the project type. Refer to the documentation for supported languages/platforms.
What is the purpose of the --exclude-type option?
It specifies project types to exclude. Refer to the documentation for supported languages/platforms.
What is the purpose of the -r or --recurse option?
It enables or disables recursive mode, which is suitable for mono-repos. It defaults to true. Pass --no-recurse to disable it.
What is the purpose of the -p or --print option?
It prints the SBOM as a table with a tree structure.
What is the purpose of the -c or --resolve-class option?
It resolves class names for packages, currently only for jars.
What is the purpose of the --deep option?
It performs deep searches for components, useful while scanning C/C++ apps, live OS, and oci images.
What is the purpose of the --server-url option?
It specifies the Dependency Track URL (e.g., https://deptrack.cyclonedx.io).
What is the purpose of the --api-key option?
It specifies the Dependency Track API key.
What is the purpose of the --project-group option?
It specifies the Dependency Track project group.
What is the purpose of the --project-name option?
It specifies the Dependency Track project name. If not provided, the directory name is used.
What is the purpose of the --project-version option?
It specifies the Dependency Track project version. The default is an empty string.
What is the purpose of the --project-id option?
It specifies the Dependency Track project ID. Provide either the ID or the project name and version.
What is the purpose of the --parent-project-id option?
It specifies the Dependency Track parent project ID.
What is the purpose of the --required-only option?
It includes only the packages with the required scope on the SBOM and sets compositions.aggregate to incomplete (unless --no-auto-compositions is passed).
What is the purpose of the --fail-on-error option?
It causes cdxgen to fail if any dependency extractor fails.
What is the purpose of the --no-babel option?
It disables the use of babel to perform usage analysis for JavaScript/TypeScript projects.
What is the purpose of the --generate-key-and-sign option?
It generates an RSA public/private key pair and then signs the generated SBOM using JSON Web Signatures.
What is the purpose of the --server option?
It runs cdxgen as a server.
What is the purpose of the --server-host option?
It specifies the listen address for the server. The default is 127.0.0.1.
What is the purpose of the --server-port option?
It specifies the listen port for the server. The default is 9090.
What is the purpose of the --install-deps option?
It automatically installs dependencies for some projects. It defaults to true but is disabled for containers and oci scans. Use --no-install-deps to disable.
What is the purpose of the --validate option?
It validates the generated SBOM using json schema. It defaults to true. Pass --no-validate to disable.
What is the purpose of the --evidence option?
It generates an SBOM with evidence for supported languages.
What is the purpose of the --spec-version option?
It specifies the CycloneDX Specification version to use. It defaults to 1.6.
What is the purpose of the --filter option?
It filters components containing this word in the purl or component.properties.value. Multiple values are allowed.
What is the purpose of the --only option?
It includes components only containing this word in the purl. Useful to generate BOM with first party components alone. Multiple values allowed.
What is the purpose of the --author option?
The person(s) who created the BOM. Set this value if you're intending the modify the BOM and claim authorship. It defaults to OWASP Foundation.
What is the purpose of the --profile option?
Specifies the BOM profile to use for generation. Default is generic.
What are the possible values of the --profile option?
Possible values are: appsec, research, operational, threat-modeling, license-compliance, generic, machine-learning, ml, deep-learning, ml-deep, ml-tiny.
What is the purpose of the --exclude option?
It specifies additional glob pattern(s) to ignore.
What is the purpose of the --include-formulation option?
It generates formulation section with git metadata and build tools. Defaults to false.
What is the purpose of the --include-crypto option?
It includes crypto libraries as components. Defaults to false.
What is the purpose of the --standard option?

The list of standards which may consist of regulations, industry or organizational-specific standards, maturity models, best practices, or any other requirements which can be evaluated against or attested to.
What are the possible values for the --standard option?
Possible values include asvs-5.0, asvs-4.0.3, bsimm-v13, masvs-2.0.0, nist_ssdf-1.1, pcissc-secure-slc-1.1, scvs-1.0.0, ssaf-DRAFT-2023-11.
What is the purpose of the --min-confidence option?
Minimum confidence needed for the identity of a component from 0 - 1, where 1 is 100% confidence. Defaults to 0.
What is the purpose of the --technique option?
Analysis technique to use.
What are the possible values for --technique?
Possible values: auto, source-code-analysis, binary-analysis, manifest-analysis, hash-comparison, instrumentation, filename.
What is the purpose of the --auto-compositions option?
Automatically set compositions when the BOM was filtered. Defaults to true.
If a boolean argument has --no prefix, what does it mean?
All boolean arguments accept --no prefix to toggle the behavior.
What is the purpose of the --skip-dt-tls-check option?
Skip TLS certificate check when calling Dependency-Track. Defaults to false.
